Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2012 03:00AM SusannahW wrote: Dianefights, I didn't have an infection, but I know that it is not uncommon. We had blood tests every 2 weeks to check for infection. It must be scary, but I'm sure it will clear up promptly with antibiotics and you'll be back on schedule.

Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2012 06:45AM SusannahW wrote: KCB-I started to get tired by the start of the 6th week. I probably could have worked, I just became extremely tired in the early evening, and had to go to bed around 8 at night. During the day I was not that tired, and my energy level was not really reduced. Hope this helps-I think you'll do fine at work.

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2012 02:16PM SusannahW wrote: Aquaphor washes out of cotton easily, no stain, but I'm not sure how well it would wash out of silk or a synthetic. Re the tats- I had 2, they hurt some, less so than the wires before surgery, and the pain is over quickly. This is not a pain you need to worry about though, you've already gone through far worse.

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2012 12:38PM SusannahW wrote: Babette, don't be disheartened by reports of SEs after radiation. For most of us, recovery is smooth, my breast only got pink and red during tx, and now almost 3 weeks after rads it is almost back to normal, just a little residual redness and chafing if I wear a bra too long. Even those who do have SEs after tx eventually heal.
Posts.Title: July 2012 Radiation Belinda977 graced

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2012 07:56AM SusannahW wrote: 3 weeks post rads and all the swelling seems to be gone. Just a little pink in a couple of areas, using deodorant again(yay!) and just starting to swim in a pool. Fatigue almost gone, just a little tired earlier than usual in the evenings. Hope all of you are getting through your rads okay, the end is in sight!

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2012 09:54AM SusannahW wrote: Kjiberty, I cried when the machine went down, and my rad finish date was postponed. It all takes a toll, especially in your case, when u are getting ready for the wedding. I felt ridiculous to be so upset over it, but I think the hardest part of rads is the emotional part of going in every day, and when that gets interrupted I felt lost. I felt fine once I got back on course.
Posts.Title: July 2012 Radiation Belinda977 graced

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2012 08:44PM SusannahW wrote: Yes, my breast swelled quite a bit, which my RO said was normal. One week after finishing it's just as swollen. It takes time to return to true size.

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2012 06:44PM SusannahW wrote: Isabells, my breast got very pink after the first few rads, but never really got any redder, except for just below the breast. When I had my boosts the targeted area got pink, but now after 2 weeks, my entire breast is almost back to normal, so don't assume that an early reaction means anything.
